title: If every kit had Lee Sin's design philosophy...
body:
Let's play a game. Let's add something to a champion that really feels tacked onto. As in, it feels like it's there just because, and adds a weirdly, small-enough-to-be-forgettable, strong-enough-to-matter amount of power.

Lee Sin'ize a kit.

I'm usually not one to complain, and I don't dislike Lee Sin, but a lot of what he has in his kit feels completely redundant.


Example:

Pantheon now can W himself, (obviously) not stunning but refreshing his passive (In the same way Lee can Safeguard himself).

Let me try to explain this.

What does lee sin have on his kit?

Knockup/back, Attack speed steroid, skill shot reveal, Lifesteal, Spellvamp, Shield, Dash x2, execute %hp damage, AoE slow, AoE reveal, 3rd Highest AD scaling ability in the game, 3rd highest Base physical damage ult in the game, HIGHEST potential physical damage Ult in the game, Energy based, Best energy regen mechanic in the game.

Then take Fiora who has the highest base physical damage ult in the game.

AD steroid, Dash x2, MS boost, untargetablility, reposte, Attack Speed steroid, minior heal passive, Highest base damage ult, 3rd highest potental damage ult.

Lee has 16 things going for him if we include the ult, 13 if we don't.

Fiora has 10 if we include the ult, 8 if we don't.

Lee has many things that re tacked on and unnecessary (this is due to every ability (even second casts) need to feel impactful).

Does Lee need a shield AND Lifesteal/Spellvamp, no but why not. Does he need the %HP execute damage and very high base damages, no but why not.
